intro: Davya crassiramis, commonly known as the broad-leafed davya, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural gardens.
